intro: Adenocalymma bilabiatum, commonly known as the two-lipped rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with two distinct lips. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, which is a notable botanical feature. Adenocalymma bilabiatum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
